p: Another key element of stigma is power: “Stigmatization is entirely contingent on access to social, economic, and political power that allows the identification of differentness, the construction of stereotypes, the separation of labeled persons into distinct categories, and the full execution of disapproval, rejection, exclusion, and discrimination” (Link and Phelan, 2001, p. 367 [ 9]). Stigma is something that is socially conferred—that both signals the recognition of difference and devalues the person [ 10].
